sentences: Talvel on päevad lühikesed, kevade poole pikemad.
context: 'Päevad' is the plural form of 'päev', which means 'day'. In Estonian, it refers to multiple days or periods of time. It can refer to actual calendar days (like Monday, Tuesday), daytime hours when there is daylight, or more abstract periods of time in someone's life or history. The word carries connotations of the passage of time and daily routines.
